ygData.subject: Large vs Small/Med, HT, and the SD
ygData.msgSnippet: ... to ... pulled ... such ... into, ... Is that really such a bad thing? It takes us SO long to get up there in levels that we should be rewarded with these
ygData.messageBody:
> So let's try another approach: what WOULD you like to see about the class
to
> make it more viable? The reason the high level shields and DoTs were
pulled
> is because (believe it or not) a lot of the players here are SKs and as
such
> know the class real well and giving them those capabilities made them
into,
> literally, tank mages. It's a scary sight seeing these guys at work.

Is that really such a bad thing? It takes us SO long to get up there in
levels that we should be rewarded with these awesome abilities, not punished
by paltry spells!

> As I've stated before, the thing that hurts the SK class are primarily
race
> issues -- a damage shield on a human or DE SK is not unbalancing, however
it
> IS unbalanced if you put it on a troll or ogre SK.
>
> So what can be changed that makes the class more viable for non-big-races
> but at the same time is not unbalancing for trolls/ogres?

Items. Items would be really the only thing you could reasonably restrict to
JUST small and medium sizes. If you add or change spells, the trolls/ogres
would go out and get Int jewelry, etc. There are already SK items that
exclude some races (i.e. humans) so just throw in some more but leave off
the ogres and trolls. Those greaves someone mentioned sounded cool -- grants
banshee aura to only smalls and mediums, LOL!

> I know HT comes up a lot, but there is a fear that HT could end up being
> heavily abused (worst nightmare....party of 6 50th level SKs stand around
> Mr. Named Mob that only pops once a day anyway, BAM 3000HP gone instantly
> and you now have a mob that starts the fight at 1/2 HP).
>
> If HT was upped slightly, had a slightly higher recharge rate, etc...what
> are your suggestions?

Ah yes, good ole' HT. When compared to a paladin's LOH ability, HT simply
stinks. Let's take level 30, for example. If you are a paladin or SK at
level 30, you have about 700 or so hit points (being conservative). So, the
paladin is in a bad fight, he's down to 20 hp, and he hits LOH -- boom, he
just did a 700hp heal. Same situation, this time it's an SK. The SK is in a
bad fight, he's down to 20 hp, and he hits HT -- boom, he does 301hp of
damage and kills the mob (ideal scenario). Both get their specials once a
game day. So what's wrong with this picture? The paladin did 700, the SK did
300, THAT is the problem. If the paladin were to LOH a warrior friend,
there's 1000 hp heal. If the SK were to HT a different mob, he still does
300 at best.

So there are three possible solutions to this:

(1.) Make the HT do damage AND lifetap for that amount of damage. So in that
same situation, the SK does 300 in damage, and receives 300 as a heal. That
totals 600hp, STILL less than an LOH, and it gives us a real lifesuck. I
believe this is in the current eqss SK petition Beld mentioned (and I've
signed).

(2.) Allow the HT to be the EXACT reverse of the LOH, i.e. complete death.
Why is the paladin's special able to adjust to the target, but the SK's is
not? Let HT completely kill the mob. Admittedly, this is the least plausible
answer.

(3.) Since the HT does approximately half what an LOH does (that disparity
only increases with levels, by the way), let it have half the recharge time.
That way a level 30 SK gets a pair of 300hp HTs per day, and the paladin
still just gets one 700hp LOH.

Personally, I prefer option 1, with option 3 running a close 2nd... but
there's my brainstorm.

Also, someone mentioned an SK equivalent to ghoulbane. Well, we have that,
the dark reaver. What we need is an equivalent to SOULFIRE, and better yet,
I believe that we DO! Yup, you heard right, it's out there... somewhere.
From what I've been able to gather, it's called Soul Devourer. I don't know
any kind of stats on it at all and don't really know anything about the
quest(s) for it, only that it IS quest-obtainable. There is an SK on the
cazic-thule server that I was talking to in irc one night and I kinda fished
this info out of him. The GMs on his server said he was the farthest along
on it (than anyone on ANY server). So that should tell you something, ala
this is a HARD quest. The best part is, this guy is over halfway through the
quest and only level 34, meaning you may or may not have to be level 50 to
do it. If anyone knows anymore about this (and yes, I'm talking to you too
Brian Hook!), please feel free to share. ;)
